Just a couple of notes about end of the day dismissal from the Elementary Building:

In our efforts to reduce the number of groups students are intermingled with and to always ensure the safest possible procedures for our students, we will dismiss as follows:

First, bus riders are walked to the bus by a teacher.

Next, car riders are released to parents as they come through the car rider line.

After car riders have all been released, walkers will be released out the front door. If there is a parent waiting for a child at the front door, those students will be released first, one at a time.

Finally, those students walking home by themselves will be released.

For Elementary students who are being picked up by a high school sibling, the high school sibling may come to the Elementary front door to meet the younger sibling.

Today's Scavenger Hunt Topic: Always Learning. We should always strive to learn more than we knew yesterday. Sometimes when we attempt to teach someone else, we end up learning the most. As adults, what have you learned this week? What have you learned about yourself? About your child? What have you learned about learning? What do you want to learn more about?

I would also encourage you to share with your kids what you are learning along the way. It is sometimes the most freeing and motivating to know that it's ok not to already know all of the answers, but the important thing is to keep gaining knowledge and skills.

Keep posting comments and photos! Feel free to look back at previous topics and continue to post there too! As the Elementary yearbook is being developed, we will most certainly need to include our memories of this time away from school, as it may very well have the biggest impact on how we learn in the future.

Have a great day!

1/10/2020

St. Clair County & surrounding counties have been placed under a Winter Storm Warning in effect from 6:00 PM this evening to Midnight Saturday Night.

Heavy mixed precip with snow totals of 2-4 inches & ice accumulations up to .2" are possible along with high wind gusts of up to 35mph.

These hazards will make travel very hazardous tonight into Saturday, power outages are also possible with ice accumulations combined with strong winds.

It is a great idea to make sure phones and any essentials are charged in case of power outages..also a good idea to have snacks, water & a blanket in your vehicle if you do have to get out in the nastiness.

Important Driving reminders for Winter Weather:

The most important tip is to SLOW DOWN and BUCKLE UP!! Allow extra time to get to your destination. If you don't need to be out don't go!

Allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead of you.

If you need you windshield wipers on then you need your headlights on.

Remember SLOW DOWN, BUCKLE UP and BE SAFE as it may take emergency personnel an extended time to reach you if needed.

ACFD
